rComments: Deanna organized the course in a very interesting way, and I found that the course materials were enjoyable.  The syllabus was a bit unorganized, and there were quizzes for attendance. As long as you participate, though, you should get a reasonable grade. Expect lots of writing!

She is really into her subject. She is open to questions inside class and outside class. She is available during her office hours. Usual length with her is half an hour if you go to them. At times, she is vague. All her powerpoints are online, don't really need to take notes. BUT READ READ READ!

Really boring professor, don't take a class with her. Lectures are dry and she can't keep the attention of anyone in the class. Work on syllabus doesn't necessarily match up with work given in the course, so don't expect the syllabus to be an accurate depiction of the course.

I've taken two classes with Deanna, and I noticed improvement on her teaching between them. She is somewhat entertaining and very knowledgeable, and is receptive to students during lectures. She used to read just from notes but became much more dynamic. The TAs did most of the grading, but the assignments were interesting. Lots of reading.

This class was meh. If you're interested in the subject, then you'll enjoy it. If not, then have fun trying to stay awake. A lot depends on the TA you have. My TA usually went on power trips based on her own opinions. Deanna, however, seemed nice and approachable... Take home midterm was easy... reading was boring, essays intensely graded by my TA.

I found her to be an intelligent, well-spoken, cool teacher. Very available to students, and many feminist theories. Loves her class with Tyrus, they are a great team. One of my fav classes ive taken in 4 years at UC. I disagree with others' comments, try her out- shes kind of a square, but i still love her.
Horrible teacher.  She stands in front of the class and reads from her notes the entire time...rarely looking up.  Assignments not clear...how to analyze material not made clear.  HOrrible.
Very enthusiastic animated professor.  A lot of reading but you really understand it afterward.  Very insightful information on classic works of italian literature!
